pr_title: Allow regexps for fieldnames in patterns

timeline.message:
Allow regexps for fieldnames in patterns

This closes #512

Test plan:
test file included

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason we went with =~ as syntax to use regex?
timeline.author: brendongo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2,6 +2,18 @@
 
 This project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](http://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).
 
+## unrelease
+
+### Added
+- You can now use regexps for field names:
+  ```
+  var $X = {"=~/[lL]ocation/": $Y};

replies.bodyText: I'm guessing an very old design choice. All other regexes work like this https://docs.semgrep.dev/config/simple#string-matching so this is more of a bugfix PR to allow it on keys
replies.author: DrewDennison

replies.bodyText: it comes from Perl, which uses this =~ operator. Perl is the regexp language :)
replies.author: aryx

replies.bodyText: Just wondering. It's not the best from the standpoint of a new user coming in but if it exists elsewhere then it's easier to justify
replies.author: brendongo
